str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
